Class Initializer

java.lang.Object
com.golubovich.elibrary.utils.Initializer
public class Initializer extends Object
Initializer class

Initializer class contains public method to provide initial data for program.

  • Method Details

    • initialization

      public static void initialization()
      Method to initialize program with start data

      It executes ones or never from class Serialization If serialization is unavailable, this method executes as a default It fills all fields of DataSource class, which presents database emulation as a collection of arrays It also updates/creates files containing the same information as class. Files emulate database. Each file presents a database table

    • initializeCountFromFile

      public static void initializeCountFromFile()
      Method to initialize initial value of static count variables in beans classes

      It executes ones in the beginning of program Method opens file, which contains clients (file of clients table in database) and counts lines (beans) to initialize counter in Client bean class

    • writeSingleObjectToFile

      private <T> void writeSingleObjectToFile​(String filePath, T object)
      Method to write one object to file

      It opens file and rewrite information.

      Parameters:
      filePath - - path to file (file will be rewrite)
      object - - object, we want to write to file

      object converts to json-string using side library, then string is writes to file

      See Also:
      "https://github.com/alibaba/fastjson", JSONSerializer.toJSON(Object)

    • writeItemArrayToFile

      private <T> void writeItemArrayToFile​(String filePath, List<T> items)
      Method to write list of objects to file

      Objects convert to json-strings using side library, then strings are write to file

      Type Parameters:
      T - - type of list items
      Parameters:
      filePath - - path to file
      items - - list of objects, we want to write to file
      See Also:
      "https://github.com/alibaba/fastjson", JSONSerializer.toJSON(Object)
